title: Graphical Analysis with Geo Series and Arc Length

content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graph of the function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> consists of a semicircle and three line segments, as shown in the figure above. Let <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, the integral from 0 to x, of, g of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 6 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. (a) What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ? Show the computations that lead to your answer.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The graph of the function <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> consists of a semicircle and three line segments, as shown in the figure above. Let <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, the integral from 0 to x, of, g of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 6 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. (a) What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ? Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(b) Find <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, the fraction with numerator g of x, and denominator x squared, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(c) Let <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="k of x equals, x times, g of, open parenthesis, 3 x minus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="k prime of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(d) On what open intervals contained in <math alttext="negative 6 less than x, less than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is the graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increasing and concave down? Give a reason for your answer.

(e) Find the maximum value of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(f) Find the value of <math alttext="h prime of negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(g) For what value of <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> does the series <math alttext="18 r, plus 18 times r squared, plus dot dot dot, plus 18 times r to the n power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn><mi>r</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>18</mn><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>18</mn><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> equal the value of <math alttext="h prime of negative 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> found in part (f)? Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(h) Must there exist a value of <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="negative 6 less than c, less than 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="h prime of c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to the average rate of change of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> over the interval <math alttext="negative 6 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(i) What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from negative 6 to 0, of, the square root of, 1 plus, open parenthesis, g prime of x, close parenthesis, squared, end root, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Give a reason for your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
